intro:
Wrocław is a youth- and student-friendly city.
In challenging circumstances you may use the knowledge shared by the Wrocław Police. The app has been created for everyone wishing to ensure their own safety. Just as anywhere, you may find yourself in some difficult situations, so please take a look at some advice which may come in handy:

advice.text: When withdrawing money from an ATM, protect your PIN. Cover the keypad with your hand so that no one can see your number. When you get your cash, don’t count it in public.
There are cameras in public transport such as trams and buses. If something happens, inform the driver. He or she will be able to react if you need help or direct you to the right stop.
Plan out your on-foot route so that you walk along main and lit up streets. Dark courtyards or underground passages can be dangerous. If possible, avoid walking alone.

Remember to conclude written agreements on renting a room/flat. You should keep one copy for yourself. If the owner collects a deposit, you should be given a receipt with the paid amount written on it, so that you won’t have any problems with its refund later. If the rent agreement has been concluded for an indefinite time and the rent is paid monthly, then you can terminate the agreement with a three-month notice at the end of a calendar month.
